title: Netflix Shares Sink as Subscriber Growth Misses Forecast
sub_head: The video streamer reports a jump in subscribers, though not as much as expected, helped by ‘Don’t Look Up’ and ‘Cobra Kai’
body:
Netflix Inc. said 8.3 million subscribers joined its platform in the latest quarter, slightly missing its own forecast, as a loaded content lineup failed to attract more viewers amid increased competition.
The new sign-ups brought Netflix’s paid global subscriber base to 221.8 million. The streaming platform had projected 8.5 million net new subscribers for the period, in line with the prior year’s fourth quarter. The consensus forecast among analysts on Wall Street was for 8.3 million, according to FactSet.
